summary: the Korean Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (KCDC) have been running integrated disease surveillance systems, which successfully contributed to fighting against the SARS attack. the reasons for global connection are obvious and clear, but no one volunteers. the US-CDC has invested tremendous effort in collecting nationally notifiable data since 1961. julian zelizer: comparing MERS with tuberculosis would not comfort anyone. he says it is mistaken to compare pain at present with probable outcome yet to happen. zelizer: the death of professionalism may be an unexpected result of the fashionable social network services. he says medical informatics leadership was nowhere to be found. technology can help medicine, not the other way around; that is the way medical informatics should go in between. digital technology should help clinicians restore the humanistic flavor of medicine. Neither Cyclops nor Argus are ideal to find the right path.
